docs.lead_paragraph: The murder of Dan A. Mitrione in Uruguay again focuses attention on a three-sided dilemma for which there are no easy solutions. There is the dilemma of the individual' diplomat, the dilemma of the government that sent him to a troubled area, and the dilemma of the government where political kidnappings occur.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 12 The spread of political kidnappings in Latin America is shaking governments and forcing embassies to spend more time worrying about security than about foreign relations. In the nearly unanimous opinion of officials, no solution is likely to be found, short of eliminating all terrorists.
